channel.title: Entertainment News Headlines - Yahoo! News
channel.description: Get the latest entertainment news headlines from Yahoo! News. Find breaking entertainment news, including analysis and opinion on top entertainment stories.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2013 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Al-Jazeera America prepares for Tuesday launch
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — In a warren of offices at a former bank building near Madison Square Garden, dozens of journalists are at work on gleaming new electronic equipment, ready to turn their test runs of Al-Jazeera America into the real thing.
item.media:text: NEW YORK (AP) — In a warren of offices at a former bank building near Madison Square Garden, dozens of journalists are at work on gleaming new electronic equipment, ready to turn their test runs of Al-Jazeera America into the real thing.

item.title: Chris Brown concerts cancelled in Canada
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — The promoter of four Chris Brown concerts in Canada scheduled this summer says the events have been cancelled.

item.title: Prince William describes his joy at parenthood
item.description: LONDON (AP) — His newborn son is "a little bit of a rascal" and car seats can daunt any dad, Britain's Prince William says.
item.media:text: LONDON (AP) — His newborn son is "a little bit of a rascal" and car seats can daunt any dad, Britain's Prince William says.

item.title: 1D goes 3-D in boy band's debut feature film
item.description: LONDON (AP) — In the tradition of great music movies, One Direction's feature-film debut has sex, drugs and rock 'n' roll — just without the sex or the drugs.
item.media:text: LONDON (AP) — In the tradition of great music movies, One Direction's feature-film debut has sex, drugs and rock 'n' roll — just without the sex or the drugs.

item.title: NecronomiCon to celebrate horror writer Lovecraft
item.description: PROVIDENCE, R.I. (AP) — If you've enjoyed the works of Stephen King, seen the films "Alien" or "Prometheus," or heard about the fictional Arkham Asylum in Batman, thank H.P. Lovecraft, the early 20th century horror writer whose work has been an inspiration to others for nearly a century.

item.title: 2nd Mellencamp son surrenders on battery charges
item.description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind. (AP) — The second of rocker John Mellencamp's sons has surrendered for arrest on charges of punching and kicking a 19-year-old man in southern Indiana.

item.title: Lindsay Lohan vows her troubled past is behind her
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Lindsay Lohan says this time it's going to be different.
item.media:text: NEW YORK (AP) — Lindsay Lohan says this time it's going to be different.

item.title: Dustin Johnson engaged to Gretzky's daughter
item.description: JUPITER, Fla. (AP) — PGA Tour player Dustin Johnson and Paulina Gretzky have taken to Twitter to say they're getting married.
item.media:text: JUPITER, Fla. (AP) — PGA Tour player Dustin Johnson and Paulina Gretzky have taken to Twitter to say they're getting married.

item.title: Ashes of Richie Havens scattered at Woodstock site
item.description: BETHEL, N.Y. (AP) — The ashes of Richie Havens have been scattered across the site of the 1969 Woodstock concert.

item.title: 'The Butler' serves box-office success at No. 1
item.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — "Lee Daniels' The Butler" is serving up success at the box office.

item.title: Judge OKs LA County condom requirements for porn
item.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — A Los Angeles County law requiring adult film performers to wear condoms is constitutional, a federal judge has ruled.

item.title: Obama golfs with Larry David on last vacation day
item.description: OAK BLUFFS, Mass. (AP) — President Barack Obama hit the links on his Martha's Vineyard vacation with comedian Larry David.
item.media:text: OAK BLUFFS, Mass. (AP) — President Barack Obama hit the links on his Martha's Vineyard vacation with comedian Larry David.

item.title: CNN, NBC won't be hosting GOP presidential debates
item.description: BOSTON (AP) — The Republican National Committee, responding to plans by two television networks for programs about Hillary Rodham Clinton, approved a resolution Friday to block CNN and NBC from hosting GOP presidential primary debates.
item.media:text: BOSTON (AP) — The Republican National Committee, responding to plans by two television networks for programs about Hillary Rodham Clinton, approved a resolution Friday to block CNN and NBC from hosting GOP presidential primary debates.

item.title: No charge for Kanye West in LAX paparazzi scuffle
item.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Kanye West won't face felony charges after being accused of attacking a photographer at Los Angeles International Airport. But he's not completely off the hook.
item.media:text: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Kanye West won't face felony charges after being accused of attacking a photographer at Los Angeles International Airport. But he's not completely off the hook.

item.title: Jackson's ex-wife reveals singer's private moments
item.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — A look at key moments this past week in the wrongful death trial in Los Angeles between Michael Jackson's mother, Katherine Jackson, and concert giant AEG Live LLC, and what is expected at court in the week ahead:
item.media:text: LOS ANGELES (AP) — A look at key moments this past week in the wrongful death trial in Los Angeles between Michael Jackson's mother, Katherine Jackson, and concert giant AEG Live LLC, and what is expected at court in the week ahead:

item.title: 'Duck Dynasty' star greets camo couple in W. Pa.
item.description: MARS, Pa. (AP) — A camouflage-clad bride and groom got a little advice from a bewhiskered witness on their wedding day: "Duck Dynasty" star Willie Robertson.
item.media:text: MARS, Pa. (AP) — A camouflage-clad bride and groom got a little advice from a bewhiskered witness on their wedding day: "Duck Dynasty" star Willie Robertson.

item.title: Singer Chris Brown sentenced to 1,000 hours labor
item.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — A judge reinstated Chris Brown's revoked probation Friday and gave the singer a new sentence to perform 1,000 hours of community labor such as cleaning beaches or highways, removing graffiti or performing other chores assigned by the probation department.
item.media:text: LOS ANGELES (AP) — A judge reinstated Chris Brown's revoked probation Friday and gave the singer a new sentence to perform 1,000 hours of community labor such as cleaning beaches or highways, removing graffiti or performing other chores assigned by the probation department.

item.title: Lindsay Lohan says her troubled past is behind her
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Lindsay Lohan says this time it's going to be different.

item.title: Singer Fergie officially changes her name
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — She's the F to the E, R, G, the I, the E.
item.media:text: NEW YORK (AP) — She's the F to the E, R, G, the I, the E.

item.title: Paul Frank teams up with Native American artists
item.description: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M. (AP) — It was Fashion's Night Out in Los Angeles. Celebrities and models packed parties and shopping extravaganzas thrown by designers and retailers.
item.media:text: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M. (AP) — It was Fashion's Night Out in Los Angeles. Celebrities and models packed parties and shopping extravaganzas thrown by designers and retailers.

item.title: Spider-Man show to go on despite new actor injury
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — The Broadway musical "Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark" will be performed as scheduled Friday night, a day after an actor playing the comic book hero was badly injured during the special effects-laden show. Producers blamed human error and the union representing actors vowed to investigate.
item.media:text: NEW YORK (AP) — The Broadway musical "Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark" will be performed as scheduled Friday night, a day after an actor playing the comic book hero was badly injured during the special effects-laden show. Producers blamed human error and the union representing actors vowed to investigate.

item.title: FBI probes nude photo extortion of Miss Teen USA
item.description: TEMECULA, Calif. (AP) — The FBI is investigating allegations that the newly crowned Miss Teen USA was the victim of someone who hacked into a webcam in her Southern California bedroom several months ago in an attempt to extort nude photographs from her.
item.media:text: TEMECULA, Calif. (AP) — The FBI is investigating allegations that the newly crowned Miss Teen USA was the victim of someone who hacked into a webcam in her Southern California bedroom several months ago in an attempt to extort nude photographs from her.

item.title: Canadian actor August Schellenberg dies in Dallas
item.description: DALLAS (AP) — Canadian-born actor August Schellenberg, who starred in the "Free Willy" films and appeared in numerous television roles, has died at his Dallas home after a fight with lung cancer, his agent said Friday. He was 77.

item.title: RNC votes to block CNN, NBC from hosting debates
item.description: BOSTON (AP) — The Republican National Committee, responding to plans by two television networks for programs about Hillary Rodham Clinton, approved a resolution Friday to block CNN and NBC from hosting GOP presidential primary debates.
item.media:text: BOSTON (AP) — The Republican National Committee, responding to plans by two television networks for programs about Hillary Rodham Clinton, approved a resolution Friday to block CNN and NBC from hosting GOP presidential primary debates.

item.title: 'Free Willy' actor August Schellenberg dies at 77
item.description: DALLAS (AP) — Canadian-born actor August Schellenberg, who starred in the "Free Willy" films and appeared in numerous television roles, has died at his Dallas home after a fight with lung cancer, his agent said Friday. He was 77.
item.media:text: DALLAS (AP) — Canadian-born actor August Schellenberg, who starred in the "Free Willy" films and appeared in numerous television roles, has died at his Dallas home after a fight with lung cancer, his agent said Friday. He was 77.

item.title: Crews begin work to restore vandalized RI mural
item.description: PROVIDENCE, R.I. (AP) — Efforts are underway to restore a Rhode Island highway mural created by a renowned children's book author and illustrator as part of a program to reduce vandalism after it was covered with graffiti.
item.media:text: PROVIDENCE, R.I. (AP) — Efforts are underway to restore a Rhode Island highway mural created by a renowned children's book author and illustrator as part of a program to reduce vandalism after it was covered with graffiti.

item.title: R&B singer Miguel arrested, suspected of DUI in LA
item.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — R&B singer Miguel has been arrested in Los Angeles on suspicion of drunken driving.
item.media:text: LOS ANGELES (AP) — R&B singer Miguel has been arrested in Los Angeles on suspicion of drunken driving.

item.title: Argentine rocker Charly Garcia goes orchestral
item.description: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina (AP) — One of Latin America's most influential rock stars is preparing to make good on his dream of playing guitar with a full orchestra in the majestic Teatro Colon opera house in Buenos Aires.
item.media:text: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina (AP) — One of Latin America's most influential rock stars is preparing to make good on his dream of playing guitar with a full orchestra in the majestic Teatro Colon opera house in Buenos Aires.

item.title: Robin Thicke heads to court over 'Blurred Lines'
item.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Robin Thicke is asking a federal judge to determine his song "Blurred Lines" doesn't copy from elements of two other songs.
item.media:text: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Robin Thicke is asking a federal judge to determine his song "Blurred Lines" doesn't copy from elements of two other songs.

item.title: Hit-and-run charge against Chris Brown dismissed
item.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — A Los Angeles judge has dismissed a hit-and-run driving charge against singer Chris Brown.
item.media:text: LOS ANGELES (AP) — A Los Angeles judge has dismissed a hit-and-run driving charge against singer Chris Brown.

item.title: Secrecy is priority on Salinger movie, book
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — For much of the nine years that Shane Salerno worked on his J.D. Salinger documentary and book, the project was a mystery worthy of the author himself.
item.media:text: NEW YORK (AP) — For much of the nine years that Shane Salerno worked on his J.D. Salinger documentary and book, the project was a mystery worthy of the author himself.

item.title: Review: 'Disney Infinity' invites you to dream big
item.description: In ancient times B.V.G. (Before Video Games), here's how kids played: Take all your toys — dolls, soldiers, cars, blocks, that thing you got from a cereal box — and dump them on the floor. Forget about logic or plot consistency because the most important goal is to create an entertaining adventure. (My neighborhood is still reeling from the sordid G.I. Joe-Barbie affair of 1974.)
item.media:text: In ancient times B.V.G. (Before Video Games), here's how kids played: Take all your toys — dolls, soldiers, cars, blocks, that thing you got from a cereal box — and dump them on the floor. Forget about logic or plot consistency because the most important goal is to create an entertaining adventure. (My neighborhood is still reeling from the sordid G.I. Joe-Barbie affair of 1974.)

item.title: Coffee, wine and sushi! New pregnancy book says OK
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Emily Oster isn't a baby doctor. She's an economist and a mom who wanted to know more about all those rules handed down to women after the pregnancy stick goes pink.
item.media:text: NEW YORK (AP) — Emily Oster isn't a baby doctor. She's an economist and a mom who wanted to know more about all those rules handed down to women after the pregnancy stick goes pink.

item.title: Exhibit coming to Pa. looks at life of Grace Kelly
item.description: PHILADELPHIA (AP) — The world thinks of Grace Kelly as a fashion icon, movie star, princess, wife and mother, but in Philadelphia she's first and foremost remembered as a hometown girl who never forgot her roots.
item.media:text: PHILADELPHIA (AP) — The world thinks of Grace Kelly as a fashion icon, movie star, princess, wife and mother, but in Philadelphia she's first and foremost remembered as a hometown girl who never forgot her roots.
